sen.j: 若桜藩（わかさはん）は因幡国八東郡（鳥取県八頭郡若桜町）周辺を領した藩。
sen.e: The Wakasa Domain was a feudal domain owning areas around Hattogun, Inaba Province (Wakasa-cho, Yazu County, Tottori Prefecture).
The Wakasa Domain was a feudal domain owning areas around Hatto-gun, Inaba Province (Wakasa-cho, Yazu-gun, Tottori Prefecture).
The Wakasa Domain was a feudal domain owning areas around Hatto-gun, Inaba Province (Wakasa-cho, Yazu-gun, Tottori Prefecture).

sen.j: 慶長5年（1600年）若桜城主・木下重堅は関ヶ原の戦いで西軍に属し、敗戦とともに自害したため廃絶となった。
sen.e: The lord of the castle in 1600, Shigekata KINOSHITA, joined the western army during the Battle of Sekigahara, and with the defeat in war he committed suicide causing the abolition of the clan.

In 1600 the lord of the Wakasa-jo Castle, Shigekata KINOSHITA, joined the western army during the Battle of Sekigahara, and with the defeat in war he committed suicide causing the abolition of the domain.
sen.cmt: 一部表現を変更しました。
sen.e: In 1600 the lord of the Wakasa-jo Castle, Shigekata KINOSHITA, joined the western army during the Battle of Sekigahara, and with the defeat in war he committed suicide causing the abolition of the domain.

sen.j: 慶長6年（1601年）摂津国三田藩より山崎家盛が3万石で立藩。
sen.e: In 1601, with the help of the Sanda Domain in the Province of Settsu, Iemori YAMAZAKI found a domain with 30,000 koku.
In 1601, with the help of the Sanda Domain in the Province of Settsu, Iemori YAMAZAKI founded a domain with 30,000 koku.
In 1601, with the help of the Sanda Domain in the Province of Settsu, Iemori YAMAZAKI founded a domain with 30,000 koku.

sen.j: 2代・山崎家治は元和 (日本)3年（1617年）備中国成羽藩に転封となった。
sen.e: Second generation Ieharu YAMAZAKI relocated to Nariwa, Bitchu Province in 1617.
Second generation Ieharu YAMAZAKI relocated to Nariwa Domain, Bicchu Province in 1617.
Second generation Ieharu YAMAZAKI relocated to Nariwa Domain, Bicchu Province in 1617.
Later, this was owned by the Tottori Domain.
Later, this was owned by the Tottori Domain.
Later, this was owned by the Tottori Domain.

sen.j: 元禄13年（1700年）に同名で鳥取藩の支藩として立藩。
sen.e: In 1700, a domain with the same name as Wakasa was founded as a branch domain of the Tottori Domain.
In 1700, a domain with the same name as Wakasa was founded as a branch domain of the Tottori Domain.
In 1700, a domain with the same name as Wakasa was founded as a branch domain of the Tottori Domain.

sen.j: 以後は鳥取藩若桜藩を参照されたい。
sen.e: From this point on, Wakasa Domain of the Tottori Domain will be referenced.
From this point on, refer to the article of the Tottori Domain.
sen.cmt: 原文wikiでは、「鳥取藩」のみとなっていましたので、左記のようにしました。
sen.e: From this point on, refer to the article of the Tottori Domain.
YAMAZAKI family
Yamazaki family
sen.cmt: 一部小文字にしました。
sen.e: Yamazaki family
The YAMAZAKI family were a tozama daimyo (nonhereditary feudal lord) with 30,000 koku.
Tozama daimyo (nonhereditary feudal lord) with 30,000 koku (1601 - 1617)
sen.cmt: 他の記事と表現を統一しました。１601ー 1617 を追加しました。
sen.e: Tozama daimyo (nonhereditary feudal lord) with 30,000 koku (1601 - 1617)

sen.j: 山崎家盛（いえもり）〔従五位下・左馬允〕
sen.e: Iemori YAMAZAKI (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade ・third officer of the Horse Office of the Left).
Iemori YAMAZAKI (Jugoinoge [Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade]), samanojo [third officer of the Horse Office of the Left])
sen.cmt: 役職名などの表現を変更しました。

sen.j: 山崎家治（いえはる）〔従五位下・甲斐守〕
sen.e: Ieharu YAMAZAKI (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade ・ the governor of Kai Province)
